ygData.subject: RE: Twinking (Was Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER* (sort  of))
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, heh It s probably not just an exploit on skellies.  Try giving an orc pawn pick to a cent some time.  I did it accidentally once, thought I had dropped
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, heh It's probably not just an exploit on skellies. Try giving an orc
pawn pick to a cent some time. I did it accidentally once, thought I had
dropped it. Its amazing how little damage a cent does when he has such a
crummy weapon. Of course with charm the range at which one could do this
expands greatly. Oh well, no moral dilemma for me as I can't charm anyhow!

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: silky@... [mailto:silky@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 22, 1999 10:52 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Twinking (Was Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER*
(sort of))


From: silky@...


Just curious.

I know if you give a necro's pet a weapon after a certain level, they get
really upset - the pet is 'nerfed' compaired to the damage it would do with
the weapon.

Hmmm, this smells like an exploit fighting harder skele's to me, or does it
work differently?



At 09:47 AM 7/22/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>
>Yes you can place items on mobs. Often times when I forage something, or
>just got done looting a mob, and another agro mob attacks, I simply click
>the item to the mod, kill it then retrieve the items.
>
>Which if bards had a more permanent charm song could really make a mean
pack
>animal/monster exploit.
>
>Bernwyn
